meta.dc:subject: legislation
meta.dc:rights: the Government of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region

longTitle.name: longTitle
longTitle.content: An Ordinance to provide for the establishment of the office of resident representative for an Existing Village; to provide for the establishment of the office of indigenous inhabitant representative for an Indigenous Village or a Composite Indigenous Village; to provide for the establishment of the office of kaifong representative for a Market Town; to provide for the elections of Resident Representatives, Indigenous Inhabitant Representatives and Kaifong Representatives; to provide for the constitution of a Rural Committee to be construed to take account of the provisions of this Ordinance; to amend the Electoral Affairs Commission Ordinance to extend the functions of the Electoral Affairs Commission (except its functions under section 4(a) and (c) of that Ordinance) to the elections of Resident Representatives, Indigenous Inhabitant Representatives and Kaifong Representatives and to require the functions of the Electoral Affairs Commission in relation to the conduct of those elections to be performed through the Director of Home Affairs; to amend the Heung Yee Kuk Ordinance to revise the terms of office of the Chairman, the Vice-Chairmen, the Ordinary Members of the Executive Committee, and the Special Councillors of the Full Council, of the Heung Yee Kuk that commenced in 1999 and that commences in 2003; and to provide for related and consequential matters.

section.name: s1
section.heading: Short title

subsection.content: This Ordinance may be cited as the Rural Representative Election Ordinance. (Amended 5 of 2014 s. 2)

section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation

subsection.leadIn: In this Ordinance, unless the context otherwise requires—
subsection.def: Assistant Electoral Registration Officer (助理選舉登記主任) means a person holding office as an Assistant Electoral Registration Officer under section 51, and includes any person appointed to act in place of such an Officer when the Officer is absent or the office is vacant;

Assistant Returning Officer (助理選舉主任) means a person holding office as an Assistant Returning Officer under section 54, and includes any person appointed to act in place of such an Officer when the Officer is absent or the office is vacant;
candidate (候選人) means a candidate who is nominated for election as a Rural Representative; (Amended 5 of 2014 s. 2)

def.name: CompositeIndigenousVillage
def.leadIn: Composite Indigenous Village (共有代表鄉村) means a community—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name of which is specified in column 1 of Schedule 3; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: which is composed of 2 or more villages—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the names of which are specified in column 2 of Schedule 3 opposite the name mentioned in paragraph (a); and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: which are identified by either or both of the following—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the particulars of the villages shown in the Index;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the particulars of the villages contained in any record described in the Index;

subsection.def: corrupt or illegal conduct (舞弊或非法行為) means corrupt or illegal conduct in contravention of the Elections (Corrupt and Illegal Conduct) Ordinance (Cap. 554);
Court (法庭) means the Court of First Instance;
Director (署長) means the Director of Home Affairs;
elected (當選) means elected as a Rural Representative under this Ordinance; (Amended 5 of 2014 s. 2)
election (選舉) means a rural ordinary election or a rural by-election; (Amended 5 of 2014 s. 2)
election petition (選舉呈請、選舉呈請書) means an election petition lodged under Part 5;

def.name: Elector
def.leadIn: elector (選民), in relation to a Rural Area, means a person who— (Amended 5 of 2014 s. 2)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is registered as an elector for the Rural Area in the final register for that Rural Area; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is not disqualified from being so registered or from voting at an election for the Rural Area; (Amended 5 of 2014 s. 2)

def.name: ElectoralOfficer
def.leadIn: electoral officer (選舉事務主任) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a Returning Officer;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an Assistant Returning Officer;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the Electoral Registration Officer;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: an Assistant Electoral Registration Officer; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: any other person—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: who is appointed under this Ordinance or the Electoral Affairs Commission Ordinance (Cap. 541) to perform functions at or in connection with an election; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: through whom the Electoral Affairs Commission, pursuant to section 9A of the Electoral Affairs Commission Ordinance (Cap. 541), performs its functions at or in connection with an election;

subsection.def: Electoral Registration Officer (選舉登記主任) means the person holding office as the Electoral Registration Officer under section 51, and includes any person appointed to act in place of the Officer when the Officer is absent or the office is vacant;

def.name: ExistingVillage
def.leadIn: Existing Village (現有鄉村) means a village—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name of which is specified in column 1 of Schedule 1; and

paragraph.name: b

subsection.def: final register (正式選民登記冊), in relation to a Rural Area, means the final register of electors for the Rural Area as compiled and published under section 17(1)(b); (Amended 5 of 2014 s. 2)

def.name: IdentityCard
def.leadIn: identity card (身分證) means—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: a document issued by the Commissioner (within the meaning of section 1A(1) of the Registration of Persons Ordinance (Cap. 177)) to a person certifying that the person is exempt, under regulation 25 of the Registration of Persons Regulations (Cap. 177 sub. leg. A), from being required to register under that Ordinance; (Replaced 1 of 2019 s. 77)

def.name: IdentityDocument
def.leadIn: identity document (身分證明文件) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an identity card; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any other document issued to a person that is acceptable to the Electoral Registration Officer as proof of the person’s identity;

def.name: Index
def.leadIn: Index (索引) means the Index of Villages for Electing Indigenous Inhabitant Representatives that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has been compiled by the Director, before the commencement* of section 4, for the villages the names of which are specified in column 1 of Schedule 2 or in column 2 of Schedule 3; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: shows, in relation to each of those villages, the name of the village and either or both of the following—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: other particulars of the village by which the village is identified;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the description of any record kept in the office of the Director, or any District Officer in the Home Affairs Department, that contains particulars of the village by which the village is identified,

def.continued: as amended under section 4 from time to time;

def.name: IndigenousInhabitant
def.leadIn: indigenous inhabitant (原居民)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to an Indigenous Village that existed in 1898 (whether or not the name the Village now has is the same name it had in 1898), means—

subparagraph.content: a person who was in 1898 a resident of the Village; or
a person who is descended through the male line from a person mentioned in subparagraph (i);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to an Indigenous Village that branched off from an Indigenous Village that existed in 1898 (whether or not the name the Village now has is the same name it had in 1898), means—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: who was at the time of the branching off a resident of the first-mentioned Indigenous Village; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: who was an indigenous inhabitant of the second-mentioned Indigenous Village; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a person who is descended through the male line from a person mentioned in subparagraph (i);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to a Composite Indigenous Village, means—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a person who was in 1898 a resident of any of the villages of which the Village is composed; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a person who is descended through the male line from a person mentioned in subparagraph (i);

def.name: IndigenousInhabitantRepresentative
def.leadIn: Indigenous Inhabitant Representative (原居民代表)—

paragraph.name: a
b

def.name: IndigenousVillage
def.leadIn: Indigenous Village (原居鄉村) means a village—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name of which is specified in column 1 of Schedule 2; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: which is identified by either or both of the following—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the particulars of the village shown in the Index;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the particulars of the village contained in any record described in the Index;

subsection.def: judicial officer (司法人員) means the holder of a judicial office within the meaning of section 2 of the Public Service Commission Ordinance (Cap. 93);
Kaifong Representative (街坊代表), in relation to a Market Town, means a holder of the office of kaifong representative established for the Market Town under section 6A(1); (Added 5 of 2014 s. 4)

def.name: MarketTown
def.leadIn: Market Town (墟鎮) means a market town—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name of which is specified in column 1 of Schedule 3A; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the area of which is coloured pink and edged red on the map that bears the number specified in column 2 of Schedule 3A opposite that name; (Added 5 of 2014 s. 4)

def.name: OfficeOfRuralRepresentative
def.leadIn: office of rural representative (鄉郊代表職位)—

paragraph.name: a
b
c
d
paragraph.content: in relation to a Market Town, means the office of kaifong representative established for the Market Town under section 6A(1); (Added 5 of 2014 s. 4)

subsection.def: principal residential address (主要住址), in relation to a person, means the address of the dwelling place at which the person resides and which constitutes the person’s sole or main home;
provisional register (臨時選民登記冊), in relation to a Rural Area, means the provisional register of electors for the Rural Area as compiled and published under section 17(1)(a); (Amended 5 of 2014 s. 2)
registered (已登記) means registered as an elector for a Rural Area in accordance with this Ordinance; (Amended 5 of 2014 s. 2)

def.name: Resident
def.leadIn: resident (居民)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to an Existing Village, means a person whose principal residential address is in the Village;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to a Market Town, means a person whose principal residential address is in the Market Town; (Replaced 5 of 2014 s. 4)

subsection.def: Returning Officer (選舉主任), in relation to a Rural Area, means a person holding office as the Returning Officer for the Rural Area under section 54, and includes any person appointed to act in place of the Officer when the Officer is absent or the office is vacant; (Amended 5 of 2014 s. 2)
Rural Area (鄉郊地區) means an Existing Village, an Indigenous Village, a Composite Indigenous Village or a Market Town; (Added 5 of 2014 s. 4)

rural by-election (鄉郊補選), in relation to a Rural Area, means an election to elect a person as a Rural Representative for the Rural Area, otherwise than at a rural ordinary election for the Rural Area; (Added 5 of 2014 s. 4)
Rural Committee (鄉事委員會) has the meaning given by section 3(3)(a) of the Heung Yee Kuk Ordinance (Cap. 1097);

def.name: RuralOrdinaryElection
def.leadIn: rural ordinary election (鄉郊一般選舉), in relation to a Rural Area, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the first election to elect a person as a Rural Representative for the Rural Area; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the office of rural representative for the Rural Area is vacated in accordance with section 7(2)(b) or (3)(b), an election to elect a person as a Rural Representative for the Rural Area to fill the vacancy; (Added 5 of 2014 s. 4)

def.name: RuralRepresentative
def.leadIn: Rural Representative (鄉郊代表)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to a Village, means a Village Representative for the Village;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to a Market Town, means a Kaifong Representative for the Market Town; (Added 5 of 2014 s. 4)

subsection.def: Secretary (局長) means the Secretary for Home and Youth Affairs; (Amended L.N. 144 of 2022)
spouse (配偶) includes a concubine;

def.name: SurvivingSpouse
def.leadIn: surviving spouse (尚存配偶), in relation to an indigenous inhabitant, means a person who survives the indigenous inhabitant as his spouse at the time of his death and has not since his death entered into—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: a marriage celebrated or contracted outside Hong Kong in accordance with the law in force at the time and in the place where the marriage was performed,

subsection.def: Village (鄉村) means an Existing Village, an Indigenous Village or a Composite Indigenous Village;

def.name: VillageRepresentative
def.leadIn: Village Representative (村代表)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to an Existing Village, means a Resident Representative for the Village;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to an Indigenous Village or a Composite Indigenous Village, means an Indigenous Inhabitant Representative for the Village.

subsection.content: In this Ordinance, a reference to a function includes a reference to a power and a duty and, accordingly, a reference to the performance of a function includes a reference to the exercise of a power and the discharge of a duty.

section.name: s2A
section.heading: Effect of inclement weather warning etc. on date and period

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: gale warning (烈風警告) has the same meaning as in the Judicial Proceedings (Adjournment During Gale Warnings) Ordinance (Cap. 62);
rainstorm warning (暴雨警告) has the same meaning as in the Judicial Proceedings (Adjournment During Gale Warnings) Ordinance (Cap. 62);
working day (工作日) means any Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday or Friday other than a general holiday.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Electoral Registration Officer is required by section 17(1)(a) or (b) to do an act not later than a date; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the date falls on an inclement weather warning day,

subsection.continued: that section has effect in relation to the act as if it requires the Officer to do the act not later than the next working day which is not an inclement weather warning day, following the date. (Amended 8 of 2022 s. 3)

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person is required by section 36B(1) to do an act within a period; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the last day of the period falls on—

subparagraph.content: an inclement weather warning day; or
a Saturday or a general holiday,

subsection.continued: that section has effect in relation to the act as if the period is extended to end on the next working day which is not an inclement weather warning day, following the day mentioned in paragraph (b). (Added 8 of 2022 s. 3)

section.name: s3
section.heading: Map of Existing Village

subsection.leadIn: The Director shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: keep at the Director’s office each of the maps referred to in column 2 of Schedule 1; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: during the ordinary business hours of that office, make at least one copy of each of those maps available for inspection by members of the public free of charge.

subsection.content: If a map is certified by the Director as a true copy of a map on which an Existing Village is delineated, the map as so certified is conclusive evidence of the delineation of the Village for any purpose related to an election.

section.name: s3A
section.heading: Map of Market Town

subsection.leadIn: The Director must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: keep at the Director’s office each of the maps referred to in column 2 of Schedule 3A; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: during the ordinary business hours of that office, make at least one copy of each of those maps available for inspection by members of the public free of charge.

subsection.content: If a map is certified by the Director as a true copy of a map on which a Market Town is delineated, the map as so certified is conclusive evidence of the delineation of the Market Town for any purpose related to an election.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Index of Villages for Electing Indigenous Inhabitant Representatives

subsection.leadIn: The Director shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: keep at the Director’s office the Index; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: during the ordinary business hours of that office, make at least one copy of the Index available for inspection by members of the public free of charge.

subsection.leadIn: If the Director is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an entry in the Index is incorrect;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an entry in the Index ought to be removed; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an additional entry ought to be made in the Index,

subsection.continued: the Director may, with the approval of the Secretary, correct the entry, remove the entry or make the additional entry, as may be appropriate.

subsection.content: If the Director certifies in writing that the particulars of a village by which the village is identified as shown in the Index or as contained in any record described in the Index, or both, are as specified in the certificate, the certificate is conclusive evidence of those particulars for any purpose related to an election.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Office of resident representative for Existing Village

subsection.content: There is established for an Existing Village the office of resident representative with effect from the date specified in column 3 of Schedule 1 opposite the name of the Village specified in column 1 of that Schedule. The number of persons to hold the office of resident representative established for an Existing Village is specified in column 4 of that Schedule opposite the name of the Village specified in column 1 of that Schedule.
A Resident Representative shall be elected under this Ordinance.

The function of a Resident Representative for an Existing Village is to reflect views on the affairs of the Village on behalf of the residents of the Village. A Resident Representative shall not deal with any affair relating to the lawful traditional rights and interests of indigenous inhabitants.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Office of indigenous inhabitant representative for Indigenous Village or Composite Indigenous Village

subsection.content: There is established for an Indigenous Village the office of indigenous inhabitant representative with effect from the date specified in column 2 of Schedule 2 opposite the name of the Village specified in column 1 of that Schedule. The number of persons to hold the office of indigenous inhabitant representative established for an Indigenous Village is specified in column 3 of that Schedule opposite the name of the Village specified in column 1 of that Schedule.

There is established for a Composite Indigenous Village the office of indigenous inhabitant representative with effect from the date specified in column 3 of Schedule 3 opposite the name of the Village specified in column 1 of that Schedule. The number of persons to hold the office of indigenous inhabitant representative established for a Composite Indigenous Village is specified in column 4 of that Schedule opposite the name of the Village specified in column 1 of that Schedule.
An Indigenous Inhabitant Representative shall be elected under this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: The functions of an Indigenous Inhabitant Representative for an Indigenous Village or a Composite Indigenous Village are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to reflect views on the affairs of the Village on behalf of the indigenous inhabitants of the Village; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to deal with all affairs relating to the lawful traditional rights and interests, and the traditional way of life, of those indigenous inhabitants.

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (4), the reference to the affairs of an Indigenous Village or a Composite Indigenous Village shall, where there is an Existing Village—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: which has the same name as the Indigenous Village or Composite Indigenous Village; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Resident Representative for which is a member of the Rural Committee, of which the Indigenous Inhabitant Representative for the Indigenous Village or Composite Indigenous Village is also a member,

subsection.continued: be construed as including the reference to the affairs of the Existing Village.

section.name: s6A
section.heading: Office of kaifong representative for Market Town

subsection.content: There is established for a Market Town the office of kaifong representative with effect from the date specified in column 3 of Schedule 3A opposite the name of the Market Town specified in column 1 of that Schedule. The number of persons to hold the office of kaifong representative established for a Market Town is specified in column 4 of that Schedule opposite the name of the Market Town specified in column 1 of that Schedule.
A Kaifong Representative is to be elected under this Ordinance.

The function of a Kaifong Representative for a Market Town is to reflect views on the affairs of the Market Town on behalf of the residents of the Market Town. A Kaifong Representative is not to deal with any affair relating to the lawful traditional rights and interests of indigenous inhabitants.

section.name: s7
section.heading: How long a Rural Representative holds office

subsection.leadIn: Subject to sections 8 and 11, a person elected at a rural ordinary election as a Rural Representative— (Amended 12 of 2009 s. 4; 5 of 2014 s. 2)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: holds office for 4 years beginning on 1 April next following the ordinary election; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: vacates office at the end of that period.

subsection.leadIn: If a vacancy occurs in the office of rural representative for a Rural Area before the expiry of the term of office of the Rural Representative and a person is elected at a rural by-election to fill the vacancy, the person, subject to sections 8 and 11— (Amended 5 of 2014 s. 2)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: holds office from the date on which the Director received the Rural Representative Oath signed and returned by the person in accordance with section 36B(1); and (Amended 8 of 2022 s. 4)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: vacates office on that expiry of the term of office.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Rural Representative to accept office

subsection.content: A person elected as a Rural Representative is regarded as having accepted office unless the person gives written notice of non-acceptance of office to the Director within 7 days after the date on which notification of the person’s election is published in the Gazette.
A notice of non-acceptance is not effective unless it is signed by the person concerned.

A notice of non-acceptance takes effect on the date on which the notice is received by the Director and the person giving the notice is taken to have resigned from the office of rural representative on that date.

If a person gives a notice of non-acceptance in accordance with this section, the Director shall, within 21 days after receiving the notice, publish in the Gazette a notice to the effect that the person has not accepted the office of rural representative.

section.name: s9
section.heading: When a Rural Representative is disqualified from holding office

subsection.leadIn: A person elected as a Rural Representative is disqualified from holding office if the person— (Amended 5 of 2014 s. 2)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is a judicial officer;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: has, in Hong Kong or any other place, been sentenced to death or imprisonment (by whatever name called) and has not—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: served the sentence or undergone such other punishment as a competent authority may have substituted for the sentence; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: received a free pardon;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: has been convicted of an offence endangering national security; (Amended 6 of 2024 s. 188)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: without limiting paragraph (b), after being elected, is convicted—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: of having engaged in corrupt or illegal conduct;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: of an offence against Part II of the Prevention of Bribery Ordinance (Cap. 201); or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: of any offence prescribed by the EAC Regulations;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: is a representative or a salaried functionary of the government of a place outside Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: is a member of any national, regional or municipal legislature, assembly or council of a place outside Hong Kong, other than a people’s congress or people’s consultative body of the People’s Republic of China, whether established at the national level or local level; or

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: is an undischarged bankrupt or, within the previous 5 years, has either obtained a discharge in bankruptcy or has entered into a voluntary arrangement within the meaning of the Bankruptcy Ordinance (Cap. 6) with the person’s creditors, in either case without paying the creditors in full.

subsection.content: Subsection (1)(d) does not prevent a person from being eligible to be nominated as a candidate at an election to be held after the expiration of 5 years after the date of the person’s disqualification.

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.leadIn: A person elected as a Rural Representative is disqualified from holding office if the person, after being elected—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is in breach of the Rural Representative Oath taken under section 36B; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: fails, or is declared or decided in accordance with any law to have failed, to fulfil the legal requirements and conditions on upholding the Basic Law and bearing allegiance to the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region of the People’s Republic of China. (Added 8 of 2022 s. 5)

subsection.content: A person elected as a Rural Representative is disqualified from holding office if the person is found under the Mental Health Ordinance (Cap. 136) to be incapable, by reason of mental incapacity, of managing and administering his property and affairs, but a person disqualified under this subsection is eligible to be nominated as a candidate at an election if it is subsequently found under that Ordinance that the person has become capable of managing and administering his property and affairs. (Amended 5 of 2014 s. 2)

A person elected as a Rural Representative for a Rural Area is disqualified from holding office if the person was not eligible to be nominated as a candidate at an election for the Rural Area under section 22. (Amended 5 of 2014 s. 2)
A person elected as a Resident Representative for an Existing Village is disqualified from holding office if, at any time after the election, the person ceases to be a resident of the Village.

A person elected as a Kaifong Representative for a Market Town is disqualified from holding office if, at any time after the election, the person ceases to be a resident of the Market Town. (Added 5 of 2014 s. 7)

section.name: s10
section.heading: How a Rural Representative resigns

subsection.content: Subject to section 8, a person elected as a Rural Representative may resign from the office of rural representative by giving written notice of resignation to the Director. (Amended 5 of 2014 s. 2)
A notice of resignation is not effective unless it is signed by the person concerned.

subsection.leadIn: A notice of resignation takes effect—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on the date on which the notice is received by the Director; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if a later date is specified in the notice, on that later date.

section.name: s11
section.heading: When a vacancy occurs in office of rural representative

subsection.leadIn: A vacancy occurs in the office of rural representative for a Rural Area if a person elected as the Rural Representative— (Amended 5 of 2014 s. 2)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is taken to have resigned under section 8(3);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is disqualified under section 9 or 36C from holding office; (Amended 8 of 2022 s. 6)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: resigns in accordance with section 10; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: dies.

subsection.content: A vacancy also occurs in the office of rural representative for a Rural Area by virtue of section 50(1). (Amended 5 of 2014 s. 2)

section.name: s12
section.heading: Director to declare vacancy in office of rural representative
section.content: If a vacancy occurs in the office of rural representative for a Rural Area, the Director shall, by notice published in the Gazette, declare the existence of the vacancy within 21 days after becoming aware of the vacancy.

part.name: P3
part.heading: Who may Vote at an Election

section.name: s13
section.heading: Who is entitled to vote at an election

subsection.content: A person is entitled to vote at an election for a Rural Area only if the person is an elector for the Rural Area.
An elector for a Rural Area is not prevented from voting at an election for the Rural Area only because the elector’s name should not have been included in the final register for the Rural Area.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (2) does not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: preclude the Court from making a determination under section 45; (Amended 18 of 2011 s. 23)

paragraph.name: aa
paragraph.content: preclude the Court of Final Appeal from making a determination under section 45B; or (Added 18 of 2011 s. 23)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: affect the person’s liability to be charged with, and convicted of, an offence relating to voting at the election concerned.

section.name: s14
section.heading: When an elector is disqualified from voting at an election
section.leadIn: A person registered as an elector for a Rural Area is disqualified from voting at an election for the Rural Area if the person— (Amended 5 of 2014 s. 2)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has ceased to be eligible to be so registered;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: is found under the Mental Health Ordinance (Cap. 136) to be incapable, by reason of mental incapacity, of managing and administering his property and affairs; or

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: is a member of the armed forces of the People’s Republic of China or any other country or territory.

section.name: s15
section.heading: Who is eligible to be registered as an elector

subsection.leadIn: Subject to this section, a person is eligible to be registered as an elector for a Rural Area only if— (Amended 5 of 2014 s. 2)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person is already registered as an elector for the Rural Area in the existing final register for the Rural Area that is in effect; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person applies in accordance with this Ordinance or the EAC Regulations to be registered as an elector for the Rural Area and is entitled to be so registered. (Amended 5 of 2014 s. 2)

subsection.content: A person is not, by virtue of being registered as an elector for an Existing Village in the existing final register for the Village that is in effect, entitled to have the person’s name included as an elector for the Village in any subsequent provisional register for the Village if the Electoral Registration Officer is satisfied on reasonable grounds that the person has not been a resident of the Village for the 3 years immediately before the compilation of the register. The Electoral Registration Officer may omit the person’s name from the final register for the Village.

subsection.name: 3a
subsection.content: A person is not, because of being registered as an elector for a Market Town in the existing final register for the Market Town that is in effect, entitled to have the person’s name included as an elector for the Market Town in any subsequent provisional register for the Market Town if the Electoral Registration Officer is satisfied on reasonable grounds that the person has not been a resident of the Market Town for the 3 years immediately before the compilation of the provisional register. The Electoral Registration Officer may omit the person’s name from the final register for the Market Town. (Added 5 of 2014 s. 8)

subsection.leadIn: A person is not eligible to be registered as an elector for an Existing Village unless the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is a resident of the Village;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has been a resident of the Village for the 3 years immediately before the date of application for registration;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: is an adult, or will be an adult on or before 20 October next following the person’s application for registration; and (Amended 12 of 2009 s. 6)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: is a Hong Kong permanent resident.

subsection.leadIn: A person is not eligible to be registered as an elector for an Indigenous Village or a Composite Indigenous Village unless the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is an indigenous inhabitant of the Village, or a spouse or surviving spouse of an indigenous inhabitant of the Village;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is an adult, or will be an adult on or before 20 October next following the person’s application for registration; (Amended 12 of 2009 s. 6)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: at the time of applying to be registered, satisfies the Electoral Registration Officer that the person—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: holds an identity document; or

subparagraph.name: ii
A
subparagraph.content: applied for a new identity card; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: requested the alteration of the identity card or the issue of a new identity card,

subparagraph.continued: in replacement of the identity card previously issued to the person; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: at the time of applying to be registered—

subparagraph.name: i
ii

subsection.name: 5a
subsection.leadIn: A person is not eligible to be registered as an elector for a Market Town unless the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is a resident of the Market Town;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has been a resident of the Market Town for the 3 years immediately before the date of application for registration;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: is an adult, or will be an adult on or before 20 October next following the person’s application for registration; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: is a Hong Kong permanent resident. (Added 5 of 2014 s. 8)

subsection.leadIn: A person who, but for this subsection, would be eligible to be registered as an elector for— (Amended 5 of 2014 s. 8)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: 2 or more Existing Villages may be registered for only one of those Villages of that person’s choice;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: 2 Market Towns may be registered for only one of those Market Towns of that person’s choice; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: one or more Existing Villages and one or more Market Towns may be registered for only one of those Existing Villages or one of those Market Towns of that person’s choice. (Amended 5 of 2014 s. 8)

subsection.content: A person who, but for this subsection, would be eligible to be registered as an elector for 2 or more Indigenous Villages may be registered for only one of those Villages of that person’s choice.
In subsection (7), Indigenous Villages (原居鄉村) includes Composite Indigenous Villages.

section.name: s16
section.heading: When a person is disqualified from being registered as an elector
section.leadIn: A person is disqualified from being registered as an elector for a Rural Area if the person— (Amended 5 of 2014 s. 2)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: is found under the Mental Health Ordinance (Cap. 136) to be incapable, by reason of mental incapacity, of managing and administering his property and affairs; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: is a member of the armed forces of the People’s Republic of China or any other country or territory.

section.name: s17
section.heading: Electoral Registration Officer to compile and publish registers of electors

subsection.leadIn: The Electoral Registration Officer shall compile and publish in accordance with the EAC Regulations—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a provisional register of electors for a Rural Area not later than 27 August in each year; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a final register of electors for a Rural Area not later than 20 October in each year. (Amended 12 of 2009 s. 7)

subsection.content: The Electoral Registration Officer may amend a provisional register or a final register so as to rectify any clerical or printing error or any incorrect name or address or other personal particulars of a person who is recorded in the register.
A provisional register for a Rural Area shall be based on the existing final register for the Rural Area that is in effect at the time when the provisional register is compiled.

subsection.leadIn: In compiling a provisional register for a Rural Area, the Electoral Registration Officer shall— (Amended 5 of 2014 s. 2)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: after scrutinizing the register on which the provisional register is based, strike out the names and other relevant particulars of the persons— (Amended 12 of 2014 s. 37)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: whom the Electoral Registration Officer is satisfied on reasonable grounds as being no longer eligible to have their names included in the final register for the Rural Area; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: whom the Electoral Registration Officer is satisfied on reasonable grounds as not wishing to remain registered in the register; (Amended 12 of 2014 s. 37)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: enter the names and other relevant particulars of those persons on an omissions list; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: add to the register the names and other relevant particulars of the persons whose applications for registration are received by the Electoral Registration Officer during the period prescribed for the purposes of this paragraph by the EAC Regulations and who are eligible to have their names included in the final register for the Rural Area. (Amended 12 of 2009 s. 7)

subsection.leadIn: As soon as practicable after complying with subsection (4), the Electoral Registration Officer must publish a notice to the effect that the names and other relevant particulars of the following persons have been entered on an omissions list— (Amended 12 of 2014 s. 37)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: persons who are no longer eligible to have their names included in the final register for the Rural Area; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: persons who do not wish to remain registered in the register. (Amended 12 of 2014 s. 37)

subsection.name: 5A
subsection.leadIn: The notice—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must specify the time and the place at which the omissions list may be inspected; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must be published in the Gazette and other publications (if any) as are prescribed by the EAC Regulations. (Added 12 of 2014 s. 37)

subsection.leadIn: The Electoral Registration Officer must, for the period prescribed for the purposes of this subsection by the EAC Regulations—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: keep the omissions list at the Officer’s office; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: during the ordinary business hours of that office, make the omissions list or a specific part of that list available for inspection free of charge in accordance with the EAC Regulations. (Replaced 8 of 2022 s. 11)

section.name: s18
section.heading: When final register takes effect
section.content: A final register for a Rural Area takes effect on the date of its publication and continues to have effect until the publication of the next final register for the Rural Area.

section.name: s19
section.heading: Right of appeal to Revising Officer against decisions of Electoral Registration Officer

subsection.content: A person who is dissatisfied with a decision of the Electoral Registration Officer made for the purposes of this Ordinance may appeal against the decision to a Revising Officer.
The determination of a Revising Officer on such an appeal is final.
The Electoral Registration Officer, or an Assistant Electoral Registration Officer, is required to appear as the respondent at the hearing of the appeal.

At the hearing of the appeal, the appellant or any other person concerned in the appeal is entitled to appear in person and, whether or not the appellant appears in person, to be represented by a legal practitioner or any other person.

section.name: s20
section.heading: Secretary to specify dates for rural ordinary elections

subsection.content: A rural ordinary election for a Rural Area shall be held in each subsequent fourth year after the first election held to elect a person as a Rural Representative for the Rural Area in the year in which the office of rural representative is established. (Amended 12 of 2009 s. 8)

subsection.leadIn: The Secretary shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: specify a date for holding a rural ordinary election for a Rural Area under this section; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: give notice of the date in the Gazette.

subsection.content: The Secretary may specify different dates for holding rural ordinary elections for different Rural Areas.
The date so specified is not to be earlier than 3 months and not later than one month before the new term of office of the Rural Representative concerned is to begin.

section.name: s21
section.heading: Rural by-election to be held to fill vacancy in office of rural representative

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsections (2) and (3), the Electoral Affairs Commission shall, in accordance with the EAC Regulations, arrange for a rural by-election for a Rural Area to be held in the following circumstances and not otherwise— (Amended 5 of 2014 s. 2)

paragraph.name: a
b
c
d
paragraph.content: on the making of a declaration under section 30(3) that an election for the Rural Area has failed, or has failed to the extent mentioned in section 30(3)(b).

subsection.content: The Electoral Affairs Commission is not required, on the making of a declaration that an election for a Rural Area has failed as provided in section 29(2)(a), to arrange for a rural by-election for the Rural Area to be held if the election declared to have failed is a rural by-election that was held on the making of another declaration that an election for the Rural Area has failed as provided in section 29(2)(a).

A rural by-election to fill a vacancy in the office of rural representative for a Rural Area is not to be held within the 4 months preceding the end of the current term of office of the Rural Representative concerned.

section.name: s22
section.heading: Who is eligible to be nominated as a candidate

subsection.leadIn: A person is eligible to be nominated as a candidate at an election for an Existing Village only if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is a resident of the Village;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has been a resident of the Village for the 6 years immediately preceding the nomination;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: has reached 21 years of age;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: is registered, and eligible to be registered, as an elector for the Village;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: is not disqualified from voting at the election; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: is not disqualified from being nominated as a candidate at the election, or from being elected as a Resident Representative for the Village, by virtue of section 23 or any other law.

subsection.leadIn: A person is eligible to be nominated as a candidate at an election for an Indigenous Village or a Composite Indigenous Village only if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is an indigenous inhabitant of the Village;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has reached 21 years of age;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: is registered, and eligible to be registered, as an elector for the Village;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: is not disqualified from voting at the election;

paragraph.name: e
f
paragraph.content: is a Hong Kong permanent resident; and

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: ordinarily resides in Hong Kong.

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.leadIn: A person is eligible to be nominated as a candidate at an election for a Market Town only if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is a resident of the Market Town;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has been a resident of the Market Town for the 6 years immediately preceding the nomination;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: has reached 21 years of age;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: is registered, and eligible to be registered, as an elector for the Market Town;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: is not disqualified from voting at the election; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: is not disqualified from being nominated as a candidate at the election, or from being elected as a Kaifong Representative for the Market Town, because of section 23 or any other law. (Added 5 of 2014 s. 9)

subsection.content: A Rural Representative is not eligible to be nominated as a candidate at a rural by-election. (Amended 5 of 2014 s. 2)

A person is not eligible to be nominated as a candidate at an election for a Rural Area if the person is currently nominated as a candidate at an election for another Rural Area. (Amended 5 of 2014 s. 2)

section.name: s23
section.heading: When a person is disqualified from being nominated as a candidate and from being elected as a Rural Representative

subsection.leadIn: A person is disqualified from being nominated as a candidate at an election, and from being elected as a Rural Representative for a Rural Area, if the person— (Amended 5 of 2014 s. 2)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is a judicial officer;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: has, in Hong Kong or any other place, been sentenced to death or imprisonment (by whatever name called) and has not—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: served the sentence or undergone such other punishment as a competent authority may have substituted for the sentence; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: received a free pardon;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: has been convicted of an offence endangering national security; (Amended 6 of 2024 s. 189)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: on the date of nomination, or of the election, is serving a sentence of imprisonment;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: without limiting paragraph (b), where the election is to be held or is held within 5 years after the date of the person’s conviction, is or has been convicted—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: of having engaged in corrupt or illegal conduct;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: of an offence against Part II of the Prevention of Bribery Ordinance (Cap. 201); or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: of any offence prescribed by the EAC Regulations;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: is ineligible to be a candidate at the election, or to be elected as a Rural Representative for the Rural Area, because of the operation of this Ordinance or any other law; (Amended 5 of 2014 s. 2)

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: is a representative or a salaried functionary of the government of a place outside Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: is a member of any national, regional or municipal legislature, assembly or council of a place outside Hong Kong, other than a people’s congress or people’s consultative body of the People’s Republic of China, whether established at the national level or local level; or

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: is an undischarged bankrupt or, within the previous 5 years, has either obtained a discharge in bankruptcy or has entered into a voluntary arrangement within the meaning of the Bankruptcy Ordinance (Cap. 6) with the person’s creditors, in either case without paying the creditors in full.

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: A person is disqualified from being nominated as a candidate at an election, and from being elected as a Rural Representative for a Rural Area, if the election is held or is to be held within 5 years after—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the date on which the person vacates an office, or is disqualified from holding or entering on an office, under the law, for declining or neglecting to take a specified oath; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the date on which the person is declared or decided in accordance with any law—

subparagraph.content: to be in breach of a specified oath; or

to have failed to fulfil the legal requirements and conditions on upholding the Basic Law and bearing allegiance to the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region of the People’s Republic of China. (Added 8 of 2022 s. 7)

subsection.content: A person is disqualified from being nominated as a candidate at an election if the person is found under the Mental Health Ordinance (Cap. 136) to be incapable, by reason of mental incapacity, of managing and administering his property and affairs, but a person disqualified under this subsection is eligible to be nominated as a candidate at an election if it is subsequently found under that Ordinance that the person has become capable of managing and administering his property and affairs.

A person is disqualified from being elected as a Rural Representative if the person is found under the Mental Health Ordinance (Cap. 136) to be incapable, by reason of mental incapacity, of managing and administering his property and affairs, but a person disqualified under this subsection ceases to be disqualified if it is subsequently found under that Ordinance that the person has become capable of managing and administering his property and affairs. (Amended 5 of 2014 s. 2)

A person is disqualified from being elected as a Resident Representative for an Existing Village if, at any time after the close of nominations of candidates for election for the Village, the person ceases to be a resident of the Village.

A person is disqualified from being elected as a Kaifong Representative for a Market Town if, at any time after the close of nominations of candidates for election for the Market Town, the person ceases to be a resident of the Market Town. (Added 5 of 2014 s. 10)

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (1A)—
subsection.def: specified oath (指明誓言) means an oath taken under the law that the oath-taker will uphold the Basic Law and bear allegiance to the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region of the People’s Republic of China. (Added 8 of 2022 s. 7)

section.name: s24
section.heading: What requirements are to be complied with by persons nominated as candidates
section.content: A person is not validly nominated as a candidate for an election for a Rural Area unless the nomination form includes or is accompanied by a declaration, signed by the person, to the effect that the person will uphold the Basic Law and pledge allegiance to the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region.

section.name: s25
section.heading: Number and qualifications of subscribers to a nomination form

subsection.content: The nomination form of any person seeking nomination as a candidate for an election for a Rural Area shall be subscribed by at least 5 other persons each of whom is an elector for the Rural Area.
Subject to subsection (4), an elector for a Rural Area may subscribe only the specified number of nomination forms as regards an election for the Rural Area.

If an elector subscribes more than the specified number of nomination forms in contravention of subsection (2), the elector’s signature is, subject to subsection (4), inoperative on any nomination form so subscribed other than that specified number of nomination forms first delivered.

subsection.leadIn: If an elector for a Rural Area has subscribed a candidate’s nomination form as regards an election for the Rural Area in accordance with this section and— (Amended 5 of 2014 s. 2)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the candidate withdraws his nomination for election under section 26;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Returning Officer for the Rural Area makes a decision under section 27(1) that the candidate is not validly nominated for election for the Rural Area; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: the Returning Officer for the Rural Area has made a decision under section 27(1) that the candidate is validly nominated for election for the Rural Area, and subsequently— (Amended 5 of 2014 s. 2)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: comes to the knowledge that the candidate has died and gives notice of the death under section 28(1); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: varies the decision to the effect that the candidate is not so validly nominated and gives notice of the variation under section 28(4),

subsection.continued: the elector may subscribe another nomination form as regards the election, and the elector’s signature on that other nomination form is not inoperative only because the elector has previously subscribed the nomination form of that candidate.

subsection.content: If an elector who may subscribe another nomination form under subsection (4) subscribes more than one nomination form in contravention of that subsection, the elector’s signature is inoperative on any nomination form so subscribed other than the one first delivered.

subsection.leadIn: For the avoidance of doubt, it is declared that if a person is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an elector for an Existing Village; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an elector for an Indigenous Village or a Composite Indigenous Village,

subsection.continued: and the person has in one of those capacities subscribed the specified number of nomination forms as regards an election for the Village concerned, subsection (2) shall not be construed as preventing the person from subscribing other nomination forms in accordance with this section in another of those capacities.

subsection.name: 6a
subsection.leadIn: To avoid doubt, if a person is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an elector for a Market Town; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an elector for an Indigenous Village or a Composite Indigenous Village,

subsection.continued: and the person has in one of those capacities subscribed the specified number of nomination forms as regards an election for the Rural Area concerned, subsection (2) is not to be construed as preventing the person from subscribing other nomination forms in accordance with this section in another of those capacities. (Added 5 of 2014 s. 11)

subsection.def: In this section, specified number of nomination forms (指明數目的提名表格), in relation to an election for a Rural Area, means the number of nomination forms that is equivalent to the number of Rural Representatives to be returned for the Rural Area at the election.

section.name: s26
section.heading: Withdrawal of candidate’s nomination

subsection.content: A candidate may withdraw his nomination for election before the close of nominations for the election.

subsection.leadIn: The withdrawal of a candidate’s nomination is not effective unless it—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is in writing;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is signed by the candidate; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: complies with the EAC Regulations.

section.name: s27
section.heading: Who are validly nominated candidates

subsection.content: The Returning Officer for a Rural Area shall, as soon as practicable after receiving a nomination form that complies with the EAC Regulations, decide in accordance with this Ordinance and the EAC Regulations whether or not a person is validly nominated as a candidate for an election for the Rural Area.
The Returning Officer for a Village shall, in accordance with the EAC Regulations, publish a notice stating which persons are validly nominated as candidates for an election for the Rural Area.

section.name: s28
section.heading: Death or disqualification of a validly nominated candidate before date of election

subsection.content: If, after the Returning Officer for a Rural Area has made a decision under section 27(1) that a candidate is validly nominated for election for the Rural Area, but before the date of the election, it comes to the knowledge of the Returning Officer that the candidate has died, the Officer shall, in accordance with the EAC Regulations, give notice of the death.

subsection.leadIn: If a notice under section 27(2) has been published, the Returning Officer shall also, in accordance with the EAC Regulations—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: publicly declare that the candidate under subsection (1) has died; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: further declare which candidates are validly nominated for election for the Rural Area.

subsection.content: Subsections (1) and (2) do not apply if the Returning Officer has publicly declared under section 29(1) that the candidate was duly elected as a Rural Representative for the Rural Area.

If, after the Returning Officer has made a decision under section 27(1) that a candidate is validly nominated for election for the Rural Area, but before the date of the election, it comes to the knowledge of the Returning Officer that the candidate is disqualified from being nominated as a candidate at the election, the Returning Officer shall, in accordance with the EAC Regulations, vary the decision to the effect that the candidate is not so validly nominated. If the Returning Officer so varies the decision, the Officer shall, in accordance with the EAC Regulations, give notice of the variation of the decision.

subsection.leadIn: If a notice under section 27(2) has been published, the Returning Officer shall also, in accordance with the EAC Regulations—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: publicly declare that the decision has been varied; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: further declare which candidates are validly nominated for election for the Rural Area.

subsection.content: Subsections (4) and (5) do not apply if the Returning Officer has publicly declared under section 29(1) that the candidate was duly elected as a Rural Representative for the Rural Area.

section.name: s29
section.heading: What is to happen if insufficient number of candidates is nominated for a Rural Area

subsection.content: If, after the close of nominations of candidates for election for a Rural Area, no more candidates have been validly nominated for election for the Rural Area than the number of Rural Representatives to be returned for the Rural Area at the election, the Returning Officer for the Rural Area shall, in accordance with the EAC Regulations, publicly declare the candidate to be duly elected as a Rural Representative for the Rural Area.

subsection.leadIn: If, after the close of nominations of candidates for election for a Rural Area, no candidate was validly nominated for election for the Rural Area, or the number of candidates validly nominated for election for the Rural Area was less than the number of Rural Representatives to be returned for the Rural Area at the election, the Returning Officer for the Rural Area shall, by notice published in the Gazette, declare the election— (Amended 5 of 2014 s. 2)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to have failed; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: (where more than one Rural Representative is to be returned for the Rural Area at the election) to have failed to the extent that the number of candidates validly nominated was less than the number of Rural Representatives to be returned.

section.name: s30
section.heading: When election proceedings are terminated or when an election fails

subsection.content: If, on the date of an election for a Rural Area but before the close of polling for the election, it comes to the knowledge of the Returning Officer for the Rural Area that a validly nominated candidate for election for the Rural Area has died or is disqualified from being elected, the Officer shall, in accordance with the EAC Regulations, publicly declare that the proceedings for the election are terminated.

If, after the close of polling for an election for a Rural Area but before declaring the result of the election, it comes to the knowledge of the Returning Officer for the Rural Area that a validly nominated candidate for election for the Rural Area has died or is disqualified from being elected, the proceedings for the election are not to be terminated at that stage. If the counting of votes in respect of the election has not begun or is being conducted, the counting of votes is to begin or to continue as if the death or disqualification had not occurred.

subsection.leadIn: If, after the counting of votes is finished, the candidate mentioned in subsection (2) is found to be successful at the election, the Returning Officer shall, in accordance with the EAC Regulations, publicly declare the election—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to have failed; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: (where more than one Rural Representative is to be returned for the Rural Area at the election and there is another candidate returned for the Rural Area) to have failed to the extent that the number of candidates returned for the Rural Area at the election was less than the number of Rural Representatives to be returned for the Rural Area at the election.

section.name: s31
section.heading: System of voting and counting of votes

subsection.leadIn: At every election that is contested—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a poll shall be taken of the electors for the Rural Area for which the election is held;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the voting at the poll shall be by secret ballot; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the election shall be conducted in accordance with this Ordinance and the EAC Regulations.

subsection.content: The Returning Officer for a Rural Area is responsible for supervising an election for the Rural Area in accordance with this Ordinance and the EAC Regulations.
The votes shall be given and counted in accordance with the simple or relative majority system of election (otherwise known as the “first past the post” system of voting).
At an election for a Rural Area, an elector for the Rural Area may vote for not more than the number of Rural Representatives to be returned for the Rural Area at the election.

subsection.leadIn: Where an election for a Rural Area is contested by more candidates than the number of Rural Representatives to be returned for the Rural Area at the election— (Amended 5 of 2014 s. 2)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if one Rural Representative is to be returned for the Rural Area at the election, the candidate to be elected as the Rural Representative for the Rural Area is the one who obtains the greatest number of votes at the election; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if more than one Rural Representative is to be returned for the Rural Area at the election, the candidates to be elected as the Rural Representatives for the Rural Area are those who obtain the greatest number of votes at the election and then the next greatest and so on until the required number of Rural Representatives is elected.

subsection.content: If, after the counting of votes in respect of an election for a Rural Area is finished, a Rural Representative is still to be returned for the Rural Area at the election and the most successful candidates or the most successful candidates remaining (as the case may be) have an equal number of votes, the Returning Officer for the Rural Area shall determine the result of the election by drawing lots. The person on whom the lot falls shall be returned for the Rural Area at the election.

As soon as practicable after determining the result of an election for a Rural Area, the Returning Officer for the Rural Area shall, in accordance with the EAC Regulations, publicly declare the candidate who was successful at the election to be duly elected as a Rural Representative for the Rural Area.

subsection.leadIn: Despite subsection (7), if, before declaring the result of an election for a Rural Area, it comes to the knowledge of the Returning Officer for the Rural Area that the candidate who was successful at the election has died or is disqualified from being elected, the Officer— (Amended 5 of 2014 s. 2)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall not declare that candidate as elected; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: shall publicly declare under section 30(3) that the election—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: has failed; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: (where more than one Rural Representative is to be returned for the Rural Area at the election and there is another candidate returned for the Rural Area) has failed to the extent that the number of candidates returned for the Rural Area at the election was less than the number of Rural Representatives to be returned for the Rural Area at the election.

section.name: s32
section.heading: Consequences of non-compliance with requirements of this Ordinance
section.leadIn: In any proceedings brought to question the validity of an election, the Court shall not declare the election to be invalid only because of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a failure to comply with the regulations made under section 65, or the EAC Regulations; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a mistake in the use of a nomination form,

section.continued: if it appears to the Court that the election was conducted in accordance with the principles laid down in this Ordinance and the Electoral Affairs Commission Ordinance (Cap. 541) and that the failure to comply or the mistake did not affect the result of the election.

section.name: s33
section.heading: Misnomer or inaccuracy not to limit operation of election document

subsection.content: A misnomer or inaccurate description of a person, or a person’s identity document or place, specified in a document to which this section applies does not limit the full operation of the document with respect to that person, identity document or place if the description of the person, identity document or place is such as to be commonly understood.
This section applies to a provisional register, final register, nomination paper, ballot paper, notice or other document prepared for the purposes of an election.

section.name: s34
section.heading: Election to be presumed valid
section.leadIn: Every election is presumed to be valid until— (Amended 18 of 2011 s. 24)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Court determines, on the hearing of an election petition, that the election is invalid; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Court of Final Appeal determines, on hearing an appeal against the Court’s determination, that the election is invalid.

section.name: s35
section.heading: Election not to be questioned only because of defect in appointment of electoral officer
section.content: An election is not to be questioned only because of a defect in the appointment of an electoral officer if the person was at the relevant time holding office acting as such an officer at the election.

section.name: s36
section.heading: Returning Officer to publish result of election

subsection.content: The Returning Officer for a Rural Area shall publish in the Gazette a notice declaring that the candidate returned for the Rural Area at an election for the Rural Area is the Rural Representative duly elected for the Rural Area. (Amended 5 of 2014 s. 2)
The Returning Officer shall ensure that the publication and notice required by this section comply with the EAC Regulations.

section.name: s36A
section.heading: Candidate declared to be returned is presumed to be duly elected
section.content: Subject to section 50(1A), a person declared under section 36 as duly elected as a Rural Representative is presumed to be duly elected until he or she is ruled by the Court or the Court of Final Appeal, on the determination of an election petition or appeal, as not duly elected as a Rural Representative.

section.name: s36B
section.heading: Written oath of Rural Representative

subsection.leadIn: A person elected as a Rural Representative (RR-elect) must, within the specified period—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: sign a Rural Representative Oath in the form prescribed in Schedule 7; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: return the signed Rural Representative Oath, either in person or by hand, to the Director during ordinary business hours.

subsection.content: Despite sections 36 and 36A, an RR-elect must not hold office unless the Director has received the Rural Representative Oath signed and returned in accordance with subsection (1).

An RR-elect must neither perform any of the functions under sections 5, 6 and 6A, nor become a member of the Rural Committee under section 61, unless the Director has received the Rural Representative Oath signed and returned in accordance with subsection (1).

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: ordinary business hours (通常辦公時間) means the hours between 9 a.m. and 6 p.m. on any working day;

def.name: SpecifiedPeriod
def.leadIn: specified period (指明限期)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: for a rural ordinary election—means the shorter of the following—

subparagraph.content: the period beginning on the publication date and ending on the expiry of the 7th working day before 31 March next following the ordinary election; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for a rural by-election—means the period of 30 days beginning on the publication date;

subsection.def: working day (工作日) means any Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday or Friday other than a general holiday.

section.name: s36C
section.heading: Consequence of declining or neglecting to take oath

subsection.content: A person elected as a Rural Representative (RR-elect) who declines or neglects to take the Rural Representative Oath under section 36B, is to be disqualified from holding the office.

An RR-elect is to be regarded as declining or neglecting to take the Rural Representative Oath if the Director does not receive the Rural Representative Oath signed and returned by the RR-elect in accordance with section 36B(1).

section.name: s37
section.heading: Offences by electoral officers with respect to conduct of election

subsection.content: A person holding office as an electoral officer at an election who neglects or refuses to perform the functions of that office in relation to such an election commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2.
A prosecution for an offence under this section may be brought only with the consent of the Secretary for Justice.

A person is not liable to conviction for an offence under this section unless the complaint or information alleging the commission of the offence is laid within 3 months after the date of the alleged commission.

section.name: s38
section.heading: Elector not to be required to disclose how vote was cast

subsection.content: An elector who is asked to disclose the name of, or any particulars relating to, the candidate for whom the elector voted at an election is not required to answer the question.

A person shall not, without lawful authority, require or purport to require an elector to disclose the name of, or any particulars relating to, the candidate for whom the elector voted at an election.
A person who contravenes subsection (2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2.

section.name: s39
section.heading: Election may be questioned only by election petition made on specified grounds

subsection.leadIn: An election may be questioned only on the following grounds—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the ground that the person declared by the Returning Officer concerned in accordance with the EAC Regulations to have been elected as a Rural Representative at the election was not duly elected because— (Amended 5 of 2014 s. 2)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the person was ineligible to be, or was disqualified from being, a candidate at the election;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: corrupt or illegal conduct was engaged in by or in respect of that person at or in connection with the election;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: corrupt or illegal conduct was generally prevalent at or in connection with the election; or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: material irregularity occurred in relation to the election, or to the polling or counting of votes at the election; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a ground specified in any other enactment that enables an election to be questioned.

subsection.content: An election may be questioned only by an election petition lodged under section 40.

subsection.def: In this section, election (選舉) includes nomination proceedings and the decisions of the Returning Officer or any of the Assistant Returning Officer concerned.

section.name: s40
section.heading: Who may lodge election petition
section.leadIn: An election petition questioning an election may be lodged—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by 5 or more electors entitled to vote at the election; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by a person claiming to have been a candidate at the election.

section.name: s41
section.heading: Who may be made respondent to election petition

subsection.content: Any person whose election is questioned by an election petition and the Returning Officer for the Rural Area concerned may be made a respondent to the petition. (Amended 5 of 2014 s. 2)

Two or more candidates at an election may be made respondents to the same election petition and their cases may be tried at the same time, but for the purposes of this Part, and in relation to any order for giving security for costs, the petition is taken to be a separate election petition against each respondent.

section.name: s42
section.heading: Court to have jurisdiction to determine election petitions

subsection.content: The Court has the same jurisdiction and the same functions in respect of an election petition as it has in respect of an ordinary cause of action within its jurisdiction.
An election petition is triable in open court and, unless the Chief Justice otherwise directs, before one judge.

section.name: s43
section.heading: Period within which election petition and appeal must be lodged

subsection.content: An election petition questioning an election may be lodged only during the period of 2 months after the date on which the Returning Officer has published the result of the election in the Gazette. (Amended 18 of 2011 s. 26)

Despite section 24 of the Hong Kong Court of Final Appeal Ordinance (Cap. 484), notice of a motion for the purpose of an application for leave to appeal to the Court of Final Appeal under section 22(1)(c) of that Ordinance must be filed within 14 working days after the date on which the written judgment of the Court to be appealed from is handed down, and the applicant must give the opposite party 3 days’ notice of his or her intended application at any time during the period of 14 working days. (Added 18 of 2011 s. 26)

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (2)—

def.name: WorkingDay
def.leadIn: working day (工作日) means any day other than—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a general holiday;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a black rainstorm warning day as defined by section 71(2) of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a gale warning day as defined by that section. (Added 8 of 2022 s. 12)

section.name: s44
section.heading: Court may direct security to be given for costs

subsection.content: Within 5 days after lodging an election petition in the Court, or within such other period as the Court directs, the petitioner shall give security for all costs that may become payable by the petitioner to any witness who gives evidence in the proceedings on the petitioner’s behalf or to any respondent.
The amount of security to be given under this section is to be of such amount, not exceeding $20,000, as the Court directs. That amount is to be given in such manner and form as the Court directs.
An election petition is taken to have been withdrawn if this section is not complied with.

section.name: s45
section.heading: Court to determine election petition

subsection.content: At the end of the trial of an election petition questioning an election that was not contested, the Court shall determine whether any decision of the Returning Officer as to the validity of a nomination was correct and, if not correct, determine whether the person declared by the Officer to have been elected in that election was or was not duly elected.

At the end of the trial of an election petition questioning an election that was contested, the Court shall determine whether the person whose election is questioned was or was not duly elected and, if not duly elected, determine whether some other person was duly elected instead.
At the end of the trial of an election petition, the Court must announce its determination by means of a written judgment. (Amended 18 of 2011 s. 27)

The Court may, on its own initiative, provide the Secretary, the Electoral Affairs Commission or the Director with a report on any matter arising in the course of the trial of an election petition if in its opinion the matter should be reported.

The Court shall comply with any request made by the Secretary, the Electoral Affairs Commission or the Director to provide a report on any specified matter arising in the course of the trial of an election petition.
